pr_title: If two wildcards are equals, then one contains the other. (Fixes #3295)

timeline.bodyText:
Could you add a comment why this is the right check?
Or, as we discussed last week, add a comment to the method or maybe even directly on AnnotatedWildcardType that wildcards are used also for captured variables. All logic that uses AWT should be investigated once we have a separate captured type.
timeline.author: wmdietl

timeline.bodyText: Why is this only for wildcards? Isn't it enough if inside.equals(outside) returns true?
timeline.author: wmdietl
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -370,6 +370,11 @@ private boolean isContainedWildcard(
             AnnotatedTypeMirror outsideLowerBound,
             boolean canBeCovariant) {
 
+        if (inside.getKind() == TypeKind.WILDCARD
